page.title: 07ST MARY MAGDALENE CHURCH
page.content: St. Mary Magdalene is the parish church of East Ham. It was built by the Normans about 1130, as a church, and is the only Norman building n the London Postal District still used as such. Reverend J>Fellows is kept very busy performing Christenings, weddings and regular services. Most of the building is the original Norman structure, but some parts have been added. The tower was built during the Tudor period and the vestry in more modern times. Inside, there are two Norman windows and the roof of the apse has the original wooden supports, held in place with wooden pegs, not nails. You can also see a window to an anchorite's cell in the north wall-here a man or woman would live completely alone through their own choice.
